entry.title: Re: Issue with error message in change documents
entry.content:
Hi Swathi,

Maybe you could check if there is an action 'Recheck transaction' under the action dropdown list in your CD. If there is, you need to run this action to clear the error message. For the users who have access, they also need to run the recheck transaction in order to clear the header error message.

Hope this helps.

BR.

entry.title: Re: No TR Showing in the production import of task list f...
entry.content:
Hi Madhulika,

There are some possibilities of your issue:

1. Check/verify the import strategy you are using, for example, if you use status dependent import strategy, then the CDs may not appear in the task list import pop up due to the configured user status.

2. Check if your PROD system import queue is locked or not.

3. Check if there are errors in TMS alert viewer log of PROD system or not.

4. Check your TMS parameters in the PROD system->STMS.

Hope these help.

BR

entry.title: Re: Introducing the new pipeline concept in Cloud Integration
entry.content:
@ChingHong EOIO for the pipeline is in our backlog but with the current approach supporting EOIO using exclusive queues we are too restricted to implement a generic EOIO pipeline, we would need either partitioned queues or dynamic queues or a dynamic serialization context, development right now look into improving the EOIO support in Cloud Integration, this is however at the very early stage of working on concepts.

Alex

entry.title: Re: Users unable to access remittance advices after upgra...
entry.content:
Hello @kezelda 

Typically, this issue is caused by stricter role restrictions introduced in version 2508.

Key checks:

Use the IAM Information System APP  to verify the required catalogues for Manage Automatic Payments F0770 and Display Payment Runs SAP Help: IAM Information System

In Maintain Business Roles, Review the Restrictions tab carefully. Ensure that the Company Code and related fields are configured correctly. SAP Help: Maintain Business Roles

If the payment run appears for some users but not others, assign a standard SAP template role to an affected user. If it works, the issue is with missing catalogues or overly restrictive restrictions in your custom role.

Background:
In 2508, SAP strengthened the enforcement of restriction fields in several finance applications. Custom role copies created prior to the upgrade might require adjustments.

You can also check the SAP Community blog below

SAP Community-Enterprise Resource Planning Blog Posts by SAP

Let me know if it helps

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: New Pipeline Concept features: new partner id definition, alternative partner, bypass option
entry.content:
@mdhira I think you can still implement your P2P scenario without involving the major pipeline steps by directly sending your message from the first scenario-specific integration flow to the last queue, this should also be supported with the new v2 flows. However, in general the pipeline relies on the Partner Directory, custom exits were highly demanded by many customers, so in order to provide a generic solution there was no option for not including the Partner Directory dependency in the step #06, it was just a coincident that so far there was no dependency. Support for Partner Directory on Edge Integration Cell is on our roadmap planned for Q1 next year, see https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?PRODUCT=000D3A47875C1EDB98A8A910864AC24B&q=director&range=CURRENT-LAST#;INNO=59346262A6261EDF94857F3CDE5957D6

Alex

entry.title: Announcing Enhanced ‚ÄúCPU and Memory Consumption Overview‚Äù for Private Cloud in SAP for Me Reporting
entry.content:
We are excited to introduce the latest enhancement to the Private Cloud Performance section in the SAP for Me Customer Insights Dashboard ‚Äî the Memory Consumption Overview. This new feature provides a comprehensive view of Memory utilization, offering valuable insights for capacity management in SAP HANA Enterprise Private Cloud.

Why Memory Consumption Reporting Matters
The Memory Consumption Overview is designed to give you clear visibility into memory usage patterns, helping you pinpoint potential bottlenecks before they impact system performance. Tracking critical periods of high memory usage is essential for understanding the health and scalability of your infrastructure. By monitoring these trends, you can:

  • Understand resource usage patterns
  • Make informed decisions about system upgrades or resizing
  • Proactively respond to performance risks before they affect users

With these capabilities, your team can ensure stable system operation and minimize unexpected downtime.

Expanded Private Cloud Performance Sub-Sections
In addition to the existing ‚ÄúCPU‚Äù sub-section, you‚Äôll now find a dedicated ‚ÄúMemory‚Äù sub-section. The ‚ÄúDetail‚Äù sub-section has also been updated to offer combined insights for both CPU and Memory. Data from the last completed month is available from the 4th day of the following month (e.g. August data available on September 4th).

 

Sub-Section ‚ÄúMemory‚Äù

This sub-section enables rapid identification of critical memory consumption trends and measurements across your system landscape. It offers a high-level view of memory utilization for products, systems, and hosts, bringing transparency to ECS service performance and empowering fast, informed decisions.

Memory utilization is monitored hourly and categorized as critical based on the following thresholds. These are the system type and their rating thresholds for critical memory consumption (defined per system type):

  • OTHER: Average Used RAM ‚â• 95%
  • ABAP: Average Extended Memory Usage ‚â• 90%
  • JAVA: Average Garbage Collector Runtime ‚â• 5%
  • HANA: Average Used Memory > 90% OR Free Memory < 50%

Only critical measurements are considered for this overview. The percentage of critical measurements is presented using color-coded ratings for quick assessment:

  • üü¢ Green: <20% Memory Critical Consumption
  • üü° Yellow: 20‚Äì39% Memory Critical Consumption
  • üü† Amber: 40‚Äì59% Memory Critical Consumption
  •  üî¥ Red: ‚â•60% Memory Critical Consumption

Like the CPU overview, Memory Critical Consumption is tracked at the software product level, with the highest observed criticality shown from host to system to product.

You can expand the structure for more detailed analysis and easily discover critical hosts.

Please note: The Memory Consumption Overview supports data analysis for capacity planning and optimization, but is not intended for real-time or granular hourly performance monitoring. It is a support tool for Capacity Planning and Infrastructure Optimization decisions.

Analysis Example
In the below example, the host with a red rating recorded 89% Critical Memory consumption measurements in June. In July, ALL average hourly measured values for Memory consumption measurements for this host (belonging to system product SAP S/4HANA and system type ABAP) exceeded 90% for Extended Memory Usage and thus Critical Memory consumption for this month is with 100% and red rating.

Please, bear in mind that for different system types, value for critical Memory Consumption is evaluated based on categorization described above (system types OTHER, ABAP, JAVA and HANA).

Information about values for Color code rating can be shown directly in Overview screen via legend button.

Personalization and Filtering Options
You have flexible options such as changing the default 6-month period or increasing the number of visible lines (default is 15). You can filter to focus on productive systems or refine your results by specific solution area, software product, or system using the top bar filters.

 

Sub-Section ‚ÄúDetail‚Äù

The ‚ÄúDetail‚Äù sub-section offers a comprehensive, side-by-side view of both CPU and Memory Consumption Trends. These trends are displayed in a stacked column chart, which, for each month, shows the number of hosts grouped by their criticality rating. Above each bar, a line graph represents the total number of hosts for the selected period. Beneath the chart, a detailed table breaks down the data by host and by month, providing granular insight into your system landscape.

This section is fully interactive: when you select a segment in the graph (such as a red or amber segment indicating higher criticality), the table and graph will automatically filter to reflect your selection. Typically, most hosts remain in the green category (low or no critical consumption), but you can easily shift your focus to those with elevated risk.

To enhance your analysis of Memory Consumption:

  • Sort the table by "Memory Critical Avg (%)" in descending order to bring hosts with the highest ratio of critical memory measurements to the top.
  • Select a colored segment directly in the graph to filter both graph and table to those hosts and months.
  • Customize the Memory Consumption Trend graph to focus specifically on hosts with higher (Yellow/Amber/Red) critical consumption ratings. This can be done by excluding green-rated hosts (less than 20% critical measurement), No. of Hosts and hosts with missing memory readings.

For CPU Consumption analysis, similar options are available:

  • Sort the table by "CPU High" in descending order to highlight hosts with the highest proportion of high CPU usage.
  • Select colored segments (like red) in the graph for focused review.
  • Customize the CPU Consumption Trend graph to display only hosts with significant high CPU usage, excluding green-rated hosts (with less than 10% high CPU consumption), gray-rated hosts without CPU reading (No. of Hosts with No CPU Reading) and total number of hosts (No. Hosts).

Note: CPU utilization is measured and rated on physical hosts only (those with Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) in overview). Virtual hosts (those without FQDN) are shown in table without CPU data. Virtual hosts are in default CPU Consumption Trend chart shown as ‚ÄúGray‚Äù segment - No. of Hosts with No CPU Reading.

The filter options in this sub-section allow you to narrow the view by system role (such as ‚Äúproductive systems‚Äù) or by time period.

If you wish to focus on specific system types‚Äîsuch as HANA DB hosts‚Äîyou can enable the relevant filter through the ‚ÄúAdapt Filters‚Äù button. Available filters include ‚ÄòHANA‚Äô, ‚ÄòABAP‚Äô, ‚ÄòJAVA‚Äô, and ‚ÄòOTHER‚Äô.

The table below the chart is customizable: use the settings (wheel) icon to add or remove columns as needed for your analysis.

Take Advantage of Enhanced Private Cloud Performance Insights
Leverage this enhanced ‚ÄúPrivate Cloud Performance‚Äù area in SAP for Me to gain instant insight into your infrastructure‚Äôs health, make informed, data-driven decisions, and proactively optimize your capacity. With these features, your team is better equipped to prevent service interruptions, plan for future growth, and maximize the value of your SAP investment.

SAP for Me is your personalized portal. Stay informed by subscribing to this blog or visiting the SAP Support Portal and the Customer Insights Dashboard for the latest updates.

Related Blogs:

  • ‚ÄúCPU Consumption Overview‚Äù Now Live for Private Cloud in SAP for Me Reporting
  • All related blogs for Customer Insights reporting

entry.title: Re: Introducing the new pipeline concept in Cloud Integration
entry.content:
@alex_bundschuh , thanks for the update, good to know the team is trying on getting EOIO pattern supported. 

We had done our own version EOIO earlier this year via data store, but also quite restricted version. Until then JMS supported the exclusive queue few months back, we have tempted to try out applying to our interface scenarios, unfortunately the exclusive JMS queue don't provide the header "SAPJMSRetries", that making us think twice on using this as it might keep retrying the message, not behave as per SAP PO that allow default maximum 3 retries.(https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/configure-jms-sender-adapter)

Looking forward to seeing how the pipeline able to support EOIO and using in productive environment. Thanks.

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to add more than one defect category t...
entry.content:
Hi @RaghavanKathamuthu 

Thank you for your question.

The navigation parameters for Fiori apps Like preferred Mode=create&Defect Category=Z1 only accept one defect category per parameter. You cannot pass multiple values (e.g., Z1 or Z2) in the URL parameter. If you require more than one defect category, you have two options.

You can either: Create separate tiles in the launchpag configuration, each with its own parameter value for you allow the user to select the defect category manually once the app opens.

Consult Record vendor or Customer defect for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: E-Banking in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Team,


 


We are considering to use 1EG for e-banking.


For outbound process, we need to send the payment medium file to the middleware, then the middleware send the payment file to the bank.


For the inbound process, the middleware receives the bank statement file and send to SAP for posting.


Since we have limited experience with e-banking integration with SAP public cloud, kindly need your suggestions for below business scenario:

  1. How to send payment medium file to the middleware? Is it possible to store the payment medium file in a directory? Please provide the possible approach we can adopt.
  2. How to get the bank statement file from the middleware and automatically upload to SAP? Please provide the possible approach we can adopt.

We appreciate your early reply.


 


Thanks,


PERSON_NAME


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to enable the Event Mesh from the BTP Integration Suite with S/4 Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi @Hanu,
Just activating the Event Mesh capability inside Integration Suite is not enough.
You will need to create a new service instance of the service SAP Integration Suite with plan messaging-client. Make sure, to provide a Namespace in the configuration json during creation. Finally you'll need to create a Service Key/Service Binding for this instance, to expose the credentials to access the Event Mesh service. These credentials are used to create a channel inside S/4.

@prashantrakheja33 has published a blog how to do the configuration in a S/4HANA On-Premise system. Take this as a starting point. Once you have the Service Key available, you can follow this documentation.    

Best regards,
Tobias

entry.content: Great Blog

entry.title: Re: "Could Not Open App" Error in SAP Mobile Start Androi...
entry.content:
Hi @ItsMeGopi

From your screenshots, I can see that the semantic object/action mapping is available. Note the section supported devices says desktop is enabled, mobile is not checked. This is the reason why the tile works on desktop but fails to open on Android Mobile Start.

For your content manager synchronisation, even though the content is refreshed and imported successfully, the device type assignment in work zone is not automatically mobile enable for all remote apps.

To resolve the issue, under your supported device, ensure that the phone and tablet icons are checked in addition to the desktop. Save it, republish the site and then finally refresh the content on your mobile start app. Consider clearing cache. This ensure that mobile start recognises the app as mobile-enabled and can resolve the inbound navigation target.

Best regards

Chris

=> so the basic setup of a project can not be done.

thanks,
Alberto

entry.title: Re: Which technologies are used to develop travel apps?
entry.content:
Travel app development involves a mix of front-end, back-end, and third-party technologies to create a smooth and user-friendly experience. The exact stack can vary depending on the app‚Äôs complexity (like booking platforms, itinerary planners, or travel guides), but here are some commonly used technologies:

üîπ Frontend (Mobile & Web):

  • iOS apps: Swift or Objective-C

  • Android apps: Kotlin or Java

  • Cross-platform: Flutter (Dart), React Native (JavaScript), or Xamarin

  • Web apps: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, with frameworks like React.js, Angular, or Vue.js

üîπ Backend:

  • Languages/Frameworks: Node.js, Python (Django/Flask), Ruby on Rails, Java (Spring Boot), or PHP (Laravel)

  • Databases: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Firebase Realtime Database

  • APIs: REST or GraphQL for communication between frontend and backend

üîπ Third-party APIs & Services:

  • Maps & Navigation: Google Maps API, Mapbox

  • Flight/Hotel Bookings: Amadeus, Skyscanner, Booking.com APIs

  • Payment Gateways: Stripe, PayPal, Razorpay

  • Weather & Local Info: OpenWeatherMap, Yelp, TripAdvisor APIs

üîπ Other Tools:

  • Push Notifications: Firebase Cloud Messaging, OneSignal

  • Authentication: Firebase Auth, OAuth, Auth0

  • Cloud Hosting: AWS, Google Cloud, Azure

These technologies work together to support features like real-time booking, location tracking, travel recommendations, itinerary planning, user reviews, and more.

So, whether you're building a basic city guide or a full-scale travel booking app, choosing the right tech stack is key to delivering a great user experience.

entry.title: Re: Time Valuation Calculation using Job Information field
entry.content:
Hi @dnicolem,

Since the custom field is not appearing in the rule for usage, I‚Äôm not sure if it will help in this case. You may consider using the Shift Classification field in the Work Schedule instead.

contract employee (EE) will have a different work schedule, and based on that, the working hours limit may vary. So, for each work schedule, try using a different Shift Classification to identify the variations.

Once identified, you can use this classification in Time Valuations for further calculations.

Please try explore in this direction as well. 

Regards,

Santosh

entry.title: Accelerate the depreciation of one asset
entry.content:
I currently need to accelerate the depreciation of one asset. I used the Post Depreciation Manually app, and in the Transaction Type field I selected 640: Unplanned Depreciation on prior-year acquisitions. I then posted an accelerated depreciation of 500 CNY for this asset.

However, when I open Manage Fixed Assets and check this asset, I cannot see any unplanned depreciation of 500 CNY reflected under ledger 0L. What I do see is that a posting document for 500 CNY was generated.

My question is: did I use the wrong method for accelerating depreciation?

entry.title: TCDCOUPLES, SE97, source and target transaction of FI GL document

The transaction YYY is actually visible in the FI GL doc posted while the original transaction XXX isn't visible anywhere. IS there a way to trace the original transaction XXX?    

Thanks 

__PRESENT

entry.title: How to show CGST, SGST and IGST separately in Adobe Form (SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN) in SAP S/4HANA Publi
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

We are working in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition, 3-System Landscape) and using the standard billing form SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN.

Currently, in the billing document PDF we are getting only the cumulative GST value. The business requirement is to show CGST, SGST, and IGST separately in the Adobe form.
       

  • How can we extend the standard form to bring in CGST, SGST, and IGST values?

  • Is there any standard way to fetch these fields or do we need backend logic to split cumulative GST into CGST/SGST/IGST?

  • Are there any blogs, KBAs, or SAP Help documents that explain how to extend SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN for India GST scenarios?

      If anyone has already implemented this, please suggest the correct approach or point me to a reference blog/document.

Thanks in advance,
Sanjay

entry.title: Re: How to show CGST, SGST and IGST separately in Adobe F...
entry.content:
To meet your requirement of showing CGST, SGST, and IGST separately, check if the fields are already available in the standard data source. In Public Cloud, you cannot directly change the CDS view and the form SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN is bound to a pre-delivered CDS view.

So what you can do is use the Custom Fields and Logic app to see if the tax split fields are released for the business context Sales: Billing Document. If SAP has already exposed Tax Type and Tax Amount at item level, you can bind them directly in Adobe LiveCycle Designer without backend coding. In India GST localization, the tax type codes (JICG, JISG, JIIG) are often available in the billing document item tax table (PRCD_ELEMENTS equivalent in CDS). If these fields are not exposed, you cannot enhance the CDS view directly, but you can create a Custom CDS View (type: External API) joining Billing document item and Item tax details (with tax type).

Filter or group by Tax Type to get CGST, SGST, IGST amounts separately. Expose this custom CDS view as a Custom Business Object or via Custom Fields and logic so it can be consumed in the form. In Output Management Form Template app copy SDBIL_CI_STANDARD_IN to a custom form. Add new fields bound to your extended data source.

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud Series ‚Äì Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products
entry.content:
@jeetendrakapase 

Thank you for the excellent blog on custom data product generation and sharing.
Let‚Äôs take the following scenario:
Step 1: Data Extraction
Extract sales order details from S/4 (fields: SO, ITEM, MAT, DATE, CONFIRMED_QTY, DELIVERED_QTY).

Step 2: Data Onboarding (S/4 ‚Üí Datasphere Object Store)
Onboard extracted data into the Datasphere object store using replication flows.
Replication flows can handle native mappings (e.g., date ‚Üí string(8)) or template-based mappings (e.g., date ‚Üí date type).
Problem scenario: If the source system provides invalid values (e.g., .00.0000 instead of YYYYMMDD), replication flows will fail.
Example: ACDOCA with millions of invalid date records.
Question: How can we fix this situation?

Step 3: Raw ‚Üí Normal Space (Disk + Memory)
Share the raw table from the object store into a normal space (with disk + memory enabled). Perform:
Data harmonization
Data jobs (e.g., unions, mappings)
Calculated columns
Currency conversions

Step 4: Normal ‚Üí Data Mart Space
Share the harmonized fact table into a data mart space. Perform:
Business transformations
Association of facts with dimensions, texts, hierarchies
Currency conversion and exceptional aggregation
Global restricted & calculated columns

Step 5: Data Product Publishing (Data Mart Layer)
Publish the data product from the data mart layer instead of the object store.
Advantages:
Ability to use currency conversion, associations, and exceptional aggregations.
Better semantic layer for consumption.

Open Questions
Disk + Memory Spaces
Is it possible to create a data product from a space that uses disk + memory (instead of memory-only)?
Integration Hours Calculation
How to calculate the integration effort (hours) required to replicate data from S/4 to a space with disk + memory or to the object store?
Incorrect Data Handling
How can we correct invalid dates or field values (e.g., .00.0000 in date fields) when loading data from S/4 to Datasphere?
Since replication flows (RF) cannot handle such corrections directly, what is the best practice for remediation?

Thank you so much in Advance.

entry.title: Re: Advanced Valuation - Impairment - Reconciliation Account
entry.content:
No not in standard Public Cloud configuration. There is no delivered option in the Advanced Valuation to override the reconciliation account from the BP master with an alternative G/L account. The reconciliation account is always taken from the customer master data because the posting is made to the subledger (customer account), not just to a G/L account. Changing the reconciliation account at posting time would break the link between the subledger and G/L.

You cannot change the posting logic via classic substitution or BAdI in FI-GL in Public Cloud. For some reasons, if you want the postings to go to a different reconciliation account, you would have to maintain a BP with that reconciliation account and use it for the relevant transactions. But, in general, we do not follow this practice.

Run the impairment posting as standard (offset to the BP recon account). Then use a manual or automated reclassification journal to move the balance from the BP recon account to your desired G/L account for reporting purposes.

This SAP Help Post Credit-Risk-Based Impairment  confirms that in the Define Rules for Impairment step you can only choose the P/L account; the offset is always the receivable‚Äôs reconciliation account from the BP master. There is no configuration point for a ‚Äúdeviating recon account‚Äù in Public Cloud.

entry.title: Re: Public Cloud Alternative for FM DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET?
entry.content:
Okay. Try with XCO then. Class XCO_CP_ABAP_DICTIONARY, methods DATABASE_TABLE, STRUCTURE, DATA_ELEMENT, etc.

NB: for information, concerning the runtime error CALL_METHOD_NOT_PERMITTED raised when calling GET_DDIC_FIELD of CL_ABAP_ELEMDESCR:

  • There's a comment in the ABAP code: "Calling get_ddic_field by a method with language version ABAP for SAP Cloud Platform results in the runtime error call_method_not_permitted." It's the only method concerned in this class. Concerning GET_DDIC_FIELD_VALUES, I did a test and it works well.
  • The runtime error also happens for the method GET_DDIC_OBJECT of CL_ABAP_TYPEDESCR (source: Hi All,The class CL_ABAP_TYPEDESCR is released API... - SAP Community). There's the same comment in the ABAP code, and the same exists also for the method GET_DDIC_HEADER.
  • The runtime error also happens for the method GET_DDIC_FIELD_LIST of CL_ABAP_STRUCTDESCR. There's the same comment in the ABAP code, and it's the only method concerned in this class.
  • I didn't check the other RTTS classes (CL_ABAP_*_DESCR) but there's no other method named GET_DDIC_*.

entry.title: Business Partner replication to EWM ‚Äì General Role (000000) missing
entry.content:
Question:
We are working on an integration between S/4HANA Public Cloud and decentral EWM. When replicating Business Partners from S/4 to EWM (via SAP_COM_0008), we receive the following error in EWM:

Business Partner role 000000 (General) is missing.

In S/4 Public Cloud:

  • The General Role (000000) is not visible in the Maintain Business Partner app.

  • It cannot be manually assigned to a BP.

  • In the Communication Arrangement (SAP_COM_0008), there is no option to add or force this role.

  • In DRF I only see Monitor Replication, Replicate by Replication Model and Replicate by Object Selection. No customizing available to extend the roles sent.

So far it looks like this cannot be solved from the S/4 side.

Possible solution we identified:
On the EWM side, it should be possible to automatically add the General Role to all incoming BPs. This can be done for example via BAdI /SCWM/EX_BP_INBOUND. According to SAP this is the recommended approach in Cloud integrations, since Public Cloud does not expose the General Role for maintenance.

My questions:

  1. Can you confirm that the General Role (000000) indeed cannot be maintained or forced in S/4 Public Cloud?

  2. Is the approach via EWM (BAdI /SCWM/EX_BP_INBOUND) the correct and supported way to fix this?

  3. Are there any other recommended best practices for handling this issue?

Thanks in advance for your input.

Of all the ways to control the visibility of the EC, this one works really well, and runs quicker / smoother than any alternatives I had come up with (e.g. create temp instance, run action to fetch user UI Switches, change visibility of EC based on that)

entry.title: Re: How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customer
entry.content:
For customers ECC/OP/PCE please see below what we are aware and is informed in the SAP central note since its first releases.

  • Main note. 3196150 - Collective note for Euro changeover in Bulgaria - SAP for Me
  • ERP system 316222 - Local currency changeover to target currency with SAP ERP Systems (ECC) - SAP for Me
  • S/4 PCE/OP 3229024 - S/4HANA Currency Changeover - Central Note - SAP for Me

For PCE/OP customer we have two options

  1. use the LCC tool, but it can be used only with the mandatory participation of SAP (DMLT team) as a paid service and it is run in a pilot mode (not all customers will be invited but only selected few). If the customer would like to explore this option they can contact directly DMLT team as described here 3229024 - Local Currency Change - SAP ONE Support Launchpad.
  2. new company code creation. It is in the hands of the customer and their implementation partner to carry out the project. General information here 3196150 - Collective note for Euro changeover in Bulgaria - SAP ONE Support Launchpad

Additionally, our Globalization Services team also has available collaborative Workzone group for Bulgaria https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/localization/regional-collaboration

Please select the EUR Bulgaria and register. Approvals will be done by Globalization Services and usually soon.

entry.title: Single tenant User-info has been set to null by ProviderTenantNormalizer
entry.content:
Context

  • We forward the end-user token from App A ‚Üí App B ‚Üí SAP Process Automation Inbox API using a Destination with Authentication type: OAuth2UserTokenExchange.

  • com.sap.cloud.sdk.services.openapi.core.AbstractOpenApiService need a tenant id for creating apiClient.

Problem (single-tenant)

After deploying to a single-tenant account, the tenant ID appears to be cleared before our handlers run. I traced this to com.sap.cds.services.impl.mt.ProviderTenantNormalizer:

private static class ProviderTenantNormalizer implements UserInfoProvider {

  private final String providerTenant;
  private UserInfoProvider previous;

  public ProviderTenantNormalizer(String providerTenant) {
    this.providerTenant = providerTenant;
  }

  @Override
  public UserInfo get() {
    UserInfo userInfo = previous != null ? previous.get() : null;
    if (userInfo != null && Objects.equals(userInfo.getTenant(), providerTenant)) {
      userInfo = userInfo.copy().setTenant(null);
    }
    return userInfo;
  }

  @Override
  public void setPrevious(UserInfoProvider previous) {
    this.previous = previous;
  }
}

As shown, when the user‚Äôs tenant equals the provider tenant, the tenant is set to null. In a single-tenant scenario, that‚Äôs exactly our case, so the tenant is cleared before any handler is called, and the Inbox API call fails because it needs a tenant ID.

Question

What is the correct way to configure or consume a user-token forwarding/exchange destination (OAuth2UserTokenExchange) in a single-tenant environment where ProviderTenantNormalizer nulls the tenant?

entry.title: Re: Together with property 'ScheduleLineOrderQuantity' al...
entry.content:
Hello @Rawel 

It's not the POST path that's causing the error, but rather the payload itself. Two key points to note:

Date format ‚Äì use OData V4 ISO-8601 ("2025-10-08T00:00:00Z") instead of "/Date(...)/".

Quantity with unit ‚Äì always send PurchaseOrderQuantityUnit with the schedule line quantity.

Deep insert operates directly through /PurchaseOrder with nested items and schedule lines. The ‚ÄúSchedule Line‚Äù path is unnecessary unless updating an existing PO.

Also check:

PC is valid for the material

remove SupplyingPlant unless it‚Äôs an STO

don‚Äôt send empty custom fields

For more detail check you inbox

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Business Partner replication to EWM ‚Äì General Role (0...
entry.content:
To answer your first question, No, not in Public Cloud. In the Public Edition, the ‚ÄúGeneral‚Äù BP role (000000) is a technical role that exists in the backend but is not exposed in the Maintain Business Partner app, nor in any released API or DRF configuration.

To your second question, yes, you can go with this approach. Implement BAdI /SCWM/EX_BP_INBOUND in decentralized EWM. Check if role 000000 is missing in the inbound payload, in your implementation. If missing, add it before the BP is created/updated in EWM.

Best practice is to keep the S/4 side standard and handle the requirement in EWM, and monitor it.

entry.title: Re: Subtotals on Adobe Forms
entry.content:
Thanks for the blog!

I used the idea with the subtotal flag for my form.
One suggestion from my side:
If you read the subtotal flag not from the subform, you don't even need to add the field to the layout (and to hide it later).

In my case it looks like that:

 var rowCount = this._DATA.count;
 
 for (var i = 0; i < rowCount; i++) {  
   var objNameSubtotal = "$record.GT_ANNEX.DATA[" + i + "].SUBTOTAL_LINE";          
   var subtotalNode = xfa.resolveNode(objNameSubtotal);
    
   if (subtotalNode.value == 'X' ) {
     // Do something
   }
}

entry.title: Re: Is it safe to switch from "Standard ABAP" to "ABAP fo...
entry.content:
Without going to S/4HANA Public Cloud yet, if one program needs no modification, is it safe to not test it and keep the ABAP Language Version "ABAP for Cloud Development" in S/4HANA on premises?

No, it's not safe. For instance, you would get the runtime error CALL_METHOD_NOT_PERMITTED raised when calling GET_DDIC_FIELD of CL_ABAP_ELEMDESCR and few other methods (source: Public Cloud Alternative for FM DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET... - SAP Community), even if it runs in S/4HANA on premises (the kernel tests the ABAP Language Version of the class).

entry.title: üá©üá™ Service integration with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (Munich, DE)
entry.content:
This SAP CodeJam introduces attendees to service integration with the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Specifically, the Node.js flavor of CAP is used.

During this event, you'll become acquainted with how external services can be integrated and consumed from within a CAP project. In working through the exercises you'll also become comfortable with various facilities that CDS offers for declaring, relating and exposing entities, and familiar with how the SAP Cloud SDK covers connectivity and destinations, supporting such integration scenarios with CAP.

This is an in-person event only (not virtual) and is planned for Fri 10 Oct 2025 in Munich, DE. It is being kindly hosted at SAP Labs Munich, in Garching. It takes place the day before SAP Inside Track Munich which is also at the same location on Sat 11 Oct.

The instructor is Developer Advocate DJ Adams. 

There are essential prerequisites that must be completed by every attendee, before arriving at the event location. They are documented here: https://github.com/SAP-samples/cap-service-integration-codejam/blob/main/prerequisites.md.

If you wish to attend, please indicate that using the "I'm attending" facility on this page. Please note that spaces are limited - we can only accommodate 24 attendees for this event. In that context, if you indicate that you're attending and later realise you can't, please remove your name so that others get a chance instead. Thanks!

For more information on SAP CodeJam events, to ask questions, and to chat with your fellow attendees, head over to the SAP CodeJam group.
